description: Build a clearer picture of your customers in minutes!

blocks.name: lookupPersonByEmail
blocks.description: Use the person method to request more information about a specific person by email.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: email
args.info: The email address of the person being looked up.

args.name: style
args.info: The style parameter can be used to control the document structure returned. The default value, list, indicates that collections such as photos or socialProfiles should be grouped as arrays. An alternate value of dictionary is currently supported, which restructures collections as dictionaries.

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: Callback url you'd like the data to be posted back to

args.name: webhookId
args.info: You can enter anything you want here, we will just pass it back in the response. This allows you to track the webhook if you wish.

args.name: confidence
args.info: A confidence of max will return less data than usual, however, the data that is returned will have a higher likelihood of being correct. On the other hand, a confidence of low will return more data than usual, but makes the possibility of a mistake in that data more likely. med returns more data than high and less than low, with an error rate between the two.

args.name: macromeasures
args.info: FullContact has partnered with Macromeasures to power Person API's ability for providing affinity data about individuals! With this premium feature, you will begin to untap the potential of being able to better understand the people behind your queries by receiving "interests" related information

blocks.name: lookupPersonByPhone
blocks.description: Use the person method to request more information about a specific person by phone number.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: phone
args.info: The phone number of the person being looked up.

args.name: countryCode
args.info: This parameter must be passed when using non US/Canada based numbers. Use the ISO-3166 two-digit country code (Great Britain = GB). If not entered it defaults to US

args.name: style
args.info: The style parameter can be used to control the document structure returned. The default value, list, indicates that collections such as photos or socialProfiles should be grouped as arrays. An alternate value of dictionary is currently supported, which restructures collections as dictionaries.

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: Callback url you'd like the data to be posted back to

args.name: webhookId
args.info: You can enter anything you want here, we will just pass it back in the response. This allows you to track the webhook if you wish.

args.name: confidence
args.info: A confidence of max will return less data than usual, however, the data that is returned will have a higher likelihood of being correct. On the other hand, a confidence of low will return more data than usual, but makes the possibility of a mistake in that data more likely. med returns more data than high and less than low, with an error rate between the two.

args.name: macromeasures
args.info: FullContact has partnered with Macromeasures to power Person API's ability for providing affinity data about individuals! With this premium feature, you will begin to untap the potential of being able to better understand the people behind your queries by receiving "interests" related information

blocks.name: lookupCompanyByDomain
blocks.description: Use this method to request more information about a specific company by domain.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: domain
args.info: The domain of the company being looked up.

args.name: keyPeople
args.info: If true, a list of Executive and VP level employees at this company will be returned under the keyPeople field.

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: Callback url you'd like the data to be posted back to

args.name: webhookId
args.info: You can enter anything you want here, we will just pass it back in the response. This allows you to track the webhook if you wish.

blocks.name: lookupCompanyByName
blocks.description: Use this method to request more information about a specific company by name.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: companyName
args.info: The name of the company being looked up.

args.name: sort
args.info: Controls how results will be sorted.

args.name: location
args.info: If supplied, only companies matching given location will be returned. The location is a general location where one can include any combination of locality, region or country as input.

args.name: locality
args.info: If supplied, only companies matching given locality/city will be returned.

args.name: region
args.info: If supplied, only companies matching given region/state will be returned.

args.name: country
args.info: If supplied, only companies matching given country will be returned.

blocks.name: uploadCard
blocks.description: Use the Upload Card method to submit front and back photos of a business card for processing.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: cardFront
args.info: Front of the card

args.name: cardBack
args.info: Back of the card

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: Callback url you'd like the data to be posted back to

args.name: verified
args.info: Used to specify the quality of transcription. Calls to verified=medium require a FullContact premium account.

args.name: returnedData
args.info: A response can contain verified and unverified data, this parameter can be used to exclude unverified data from being returned in the response.

args.name: casing
args.info: Card Reader can alter the casing of certain fields in the final results.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Card Reader Sandbox is a free, quick response mode for testing and development.

args.name: URID
args.info: If you pass in the URID parameter, we will make sure that the request you are referring to by this id is only processed once.

blocks.name: getSingleRequest
blocks.description: Use the view single request method to view a specific transcription

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: requestId
args.info: ID of the request

args.name: returnedData
args.info: A response can contain verified and unverified data, this parameter can be used to exclude unverified data from being returned in the response.

args.name: diagnostics
args.info: With this parameter you can see what the response from your own server was when we sent out your webhook.

blocks.name: getRequests
blocks.description: Use the view requests method to view a paged history of your transcriptions.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: page
args.info: Used to page through the results. If not specified, it defaults to the first page (0).

args.name: returnedData
args.info: A response can contain verified and unverified data, this parameter can be used to exclude unverified data from being returned in the response.

args.name: diagnostics
args.info: With this parameter you can see what the response from your own server was when we sent out your webhook.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: email
args.info: The email address to verify

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: emails
args.info: The email addresses to verify

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: Callback url you'd like the data to be posted back to

blocks.name: getVerifyEmailsStatus
blocks.description: Get the state and result of a previous batch request

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: verifyId
args.info: ID of the batch request

blocks.name: getAccountStats
blocks.description: The Account Stats endpoint allows you to query FullContact to view your API account usage for the current month or a previous month that you can define using the optional period parameter.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key received from FullContact

args.name: period
args.info: You can define the month that you want to see usage stats for by using the period parameter.
